revised_title: Anomalous Behavior of Tribo-Electricity in Metals and Textiles
tldr: The authors investigate the tribo-electric properties of various elements and textiles, focusing on the anomalous behavior of certain metals. They find that surface strain plays a significant role in the charging of materials, and that the traditional tribo-electric series cannot include all solids. The research also reveals that the arrangement of elements based on their tribo-electric charges corresponds closely to their chemical qualities.
